message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.CR 

This paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it proposes a method for video smoke detection using synthetic smoke samples. It also involves object detection, which is a common topic in computer vision. 

The paper also involves machine learning, specifically deep learning, as it uses state-of-the-art single-model detectors (SSD and MS-CNN) and an end-to-end training procedure. Therefore, it is also likely to belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. 

The paper also deals with multimedia (cs.MM) as it involves video smoke detection. Finally, it may also belong to the cryptography and security (cs.CR) sub-category as it mentions the superiority of detectors based on adversarial adaptation over those based on discrepancy adaptation.
